trial_identification.studytitle: Comparing the efficacy of prulifloxacin against cefixime as a preventive treatment before transrectal ultrasound guided prostate biopsy.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Evaluating the efficacy of prulifloxacin against cefixime administration before a transrectal prostate biopsy, in order to avoid severe urinary sepsis after the performance.

interventions.interventions: Patients eligible for prostate biopsy will receive either oral tablet prulifloxacin 600mg once daily for three days (Group 1) or oral tablet cefixime 400mg (Group 2) once daily for three days, as prevention treatment before biopsy. Monitoring will be based on high fever followed with lower urinary tract symptoms up to 3 days after the performance, The adherence to the treatment will be checked, as patinets are asked to recieve each drug some hours before biopsy, inside the urology department.

primaryOutcome.outcome:
High fever with lower urinary tract symptoms
These will be chcked by self thermometry by the patient, as well as medical history is required.

secondaryOutcome.outcome:
Severe sepsis Evaluation will be performed with:
Blood and urine examintaions and cultures. Blood gas, respiratory frequence, blood pressure.

eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
Prulifloxacin or cefixime allergy
Kidney failure,
Known resistance to prulifloxacin or cefixime

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Patients eligible for prostate biopsy, either after a high PSA or a DRE finding, will receive a dose of prulifloxacin 600mg (Group 1) or cefixime 400mg (Group 2) before the performance, in order to test if lower urinary tract infection or sepsis can be prevented. They will be evaluated for urinary infection in the following 3 days, based on fever and lower urinary tract symptoms. The results will be statistically studied so as to prove any difference between the two Groups.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Scientific Committee University Hospital of Larisa
